page.title: 16Pitscottie 50 Years Ago
page.content: An elderly lady, now staying in Ceres, was asked about her memories of Pitscottie as it was about 50 years ago. She and her husband owned the general store. This is what she had to say: "When I lived in Pitscottie in 1928 there was a shop and Post Office. We don't have the Post Office any more. There was a horse and cart which delivered the groceries to surrounding farms, but the horse was finished so we got a motor instead. It was a two-seater with a bit at the back where we put the groceries. There was no garage in Pitscottie then but there was a blacksmith. We had to go down the street to get water from a pump. Pitscottie hasn't altered much apart from a couple of extra houses and they do have running water now."
